comment: This is the toughest education class I have had so far. Quizzes require reading and studying. Projects she does not just give you an A if you do it, but if you put in effort and follow rubrics then you can get an A. She is very clear about what Is expected and very helpful always. She really cares about the students and I would take her again.

Such a sweet lady. The class was so boring and lectures were so long (she just reads from her powerpoint) but she is so willing to help her students succeed. Tests come straight from the powerpoint and are SO EASY. A couple projects that are super simple, too. She loves discussions, so as long as you show up and do what you're expected...A+!
in the beginning this professor may pose as helping teacher but later she confuses the matters. She makes students work like a donkey.
Great teacher. very knowledgeable. You can tell that she is passionate about what she does. Very helpful. Best education professor I have encountered at KSU.

Dr. Salyer is extremely helpful and easy! I enjoyed what she offered to this course and would happily take her again! She is a former middle school teacher, but does a great job of teaching to all EDUC majors. TAKE HER!!

Dr. Salyer is an amazing teacher. She was the most helpful teacher I have ever had in 2 years of college. She is extremely nice and will do anything she can to help you. I strongly recommend her for EDUC 2110 and would not take anyone else!

Dr. Salyer is a very intelligent professor who does anything possible to make sure her students will succeed and get a good grade. You can tell that she really enjoys her job at KSU. The Projects in the class are quite beneficial to future teachers.
Very nice professor, if you turn in your work she will most likely give you an A.  The easiest class i have taken in college.
